page.title: 16Local History
page.content: This information was gathered through talks with Mrs. Audrey Osborne-Thomas Miss Rose Mayhew, and Mr. Charles Johnson- long time village residents. 1914 the morning after the fire only the shell of Barton Hall was left. Summer holidays were extended so that children might help with the harvest. The house now an old peoples' home was the Dower House to the Hall. Where Mrs. Thomas now lives was the Estate Steward's House. In the village street was only the Post Office\Shop a Cycle Repair Shop and a Cobbler's. Mr. Johnson son of a farm horsekeeper who earned 6s a week, taught his father to read and count. Mr. J. planted the Stud fir tree avenue. He was sometimes asked to wait at table at Barton Manor and was taught never to repeat what was said at table and he still keeps his promise.
